body_html:
@vsai121

I think you initial state should created from cell.zero_state(batch_size=batch_size, dtype=tf.float32) instead of cells[0].zero_state(batch_size=batch_size, dtype=tf.float32). cells[0] is just your first rnn layer's cell.
body_text:
@vsai121
I think you initial state should created from cell.zero_state(batch_size=batch_size, dtype=tf.float32) instead of cells[0].zero_state(batch_size=batch_size, dtype=tf.float32). cells[0] is just your first rnn layer's cell.
body:
@vsai121 

I think you initial state should created from `cell.zero_state(batch_size=batch_size, dtype=tf.float32)` instead of `cells[0].zero_state(batch_size=batch_size, dtype=tf.float32)`. `cells[0]` is just your first rnn layer's cell.
